title: ICE on invalid code

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
I know this is invalid code, but I was experimenting with syntax, when generating this ice:

``` rust
        // line is a String
        let ss: Vec<String> = line.split(' ').map(|s| s.to_string()).collect();  // ok
        let ss2 = line.split("asdf").collect()[1];  // throws ICE
        // specifically, the addition of the [1] on the end of the above line causes the ICE
```

```
rustc 0.13.0-nightly (ad9e75938 2015-01-05 00:26:28 +0000)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: ad9e759382ad7daed26f86732f41f5f83cd673e2
commit-date: 2015-01-05 00:26:28 +0000
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 0.13.0-nightly
```
